Footnotes_2014: The population estimates are from 2009 General Population and Housing. The excluded area represents approximately 20% of the total population.
Footnotes_2017: Global Findex data exclude seven regions because of security concerns and wilderness (Bourkou, Ennedi, Ouaddai, Salamat, Sila, Tibesti, and Wadi Fira) as well as quartiers or villages with less than 50 inhabitants. The excluded areas represent about 20 percent of the population.
Source_2011: Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

Footnotes_2017: Global Findex data include only Saudi nationals, Arab expatriates, and non-Arabs who were able to participate in the survey in Arabic or English.

Source_2014: Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.
Source_2017: Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

Footnotes_2014: The regions of Hiiran, Bay, Bakool, and Middle Juba are fully excluded due to the prevailing security situation. Other exclusions include isolated areas along the Somaliland/Puntland border in Sanaag, Sool, and Toghdeer, as well as parts of Bari region due to criminal activity there. In South Central Somalia, parts of Gedo and Muduq provinces were excluded due to Al-Shabab insurgent movements. Excluded areas represent approximately 32% of the population.
Source_2014: Global Financial Inclusion Database, World Bank.

TargetDesc: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all
IndicatorDesc: Proportion of adults (15 years and older) with an account at a bank or other financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider

Footnotes_2017: Global Findex data exclude parts of 9 of 10 states because of security concerns. It excludes the majority of Unity State and Upper Nile State as well as all of Jonglei State except Bor South County. The excluded areas represent 44 percent of the population.
